It may not be relevant for other folks but I\u2019m dealing with some relatively big \u201clife events;\u201d family and personal.  Somehow accounting for the black swans of life would be good.  For example in the last 3 weeks: I\u2019ve lost one of my best friends to a freak accident and I had to red eye to east coast & back to LA because my mother (who has Parkinson\u2019s) had a slip at the market.  I feel like outside my own personal health (which is strong thankfully) the other \u201clife event boxes\u201d got checked. \n\nAlso, traveling for work may have gone down but it\u2019s a huge stressor.  Especially for me When I go west to east. Long car rides don\u2019t cross time zones but present other problems.  Again - travel may not be an issue in this post Covid world but if normalcy returns it will be.

In bed 10:20 and alarm at 5:30, actually up about 6:15am, 20 min meditation and just wrapped 30 min journaling. Good start to day. I take the source with my morning bulletproof coffee after meditation but before journaling. Now will read for 30 min before starting workday. Not sure I feel the 1.25mg.

You should ask if you have, or plan to, exercise, not just if you have. The survey reads like a baseline in some places and a morning recap in others. I find it to be a little bit annoying. I'd recommend the subject fill it out at the same time that they take their dose, and that the time of dose is tracked.
